comment: She was very clear, answered questions in a timely manner and was enthusiastic when it came to explaining the course material. She made sure that you knew what was to be expected on tests and assignments through explaining the material thoroughly covering many topics. Overall, great prof., I learned alot about acct. and you will to if you take her!

This is a difficult class, but she is an excellent professor, who explains the concepts very well. There are three tests and a comprehensive final, along with excel HW assignments for points. Listen to her lectures and she will tell you exactly what will be on the tests. I enjoyed her class and thought she cares about her students.

As the previous reviewer said, her tests are very difficult.  She made comments about the tests/assessments being comparable to the CPA.  News flash: you have to have 20+ hours of accounting beyond introductory level courses just to sit for the CPA.  I doubt many in a sophomore level class are going to be rushing to take the CPA next week.

GREAT PROFESSOR!!! This is not an easy class but she will help you as much as possible to ensure you pass her class. what really amazed me is that I received an "A" in her class and it was a Summer term.
Mitra is a wonderful professor! Her class can be a little difficult, but it is for your own good. This information carries you through the rest of your education!

Great Professor! Her lectures are very interesting and helpful, with a good sense of humor. The class is challenging so be prepared for class and do the hw. There are 4 exams and she gives bonus points! Take her if you can.

She is no pushover - but if you pay attention and do the work you will learn the material.  She works for FDIC, so she brings a lot of real-world experience to the class.  She gives 50 bonus points just for attending class.  I'm not sure what class the prior commenter was in, but I thought her class was one of the highlights of my semester.

Awesome! BEST PROF EVER! She is well prepared, genuinely cares about her students, is passionate, and motivated to teach. Gives plenty of opportunities for bonus points. Class is hard so be prepared to study. The student below obviously has a personal problem with her.

Finally, my Saturdays have meaning! Tons of opportunity to earn bonus points... could have not made my A without them. Accounting is not easy for everyone, but if you stick with it, it will be very rewarding. Bathai has a sense of humor that keeps the class awake at 8am Saturday and she clearly explains the concepts.

Prof. Bathai is an awesome teacher.  She knows the material backwards and forwards.  The class is not easy, but if you work hard, study, and attend class you should be fine.  It is not an easy "A", so if you want an "A" you have to work for it.  Prof. Bathai is very passionate about accounting.  I really enjoyed her class.
She knows what she is talking about and answers any questions you might have. This is class is hard and you have to study to make an A. Very helpful.

She is very passionate and energetic about her subject and knows it like the back of her hand. The class is not easy, however, and requires true effort to make a good grade. Attend all classes. Don't take a Saturday class.

Oh Mitra. She's pretty much one of the best professors ever. She is not a pushover, and you have to study to get an A, but she is very helpful and will go over anything you do not understand. I switched my major TO accounting because of her!
AWESOME!! Highly recommend! Works for the FDIC and is very knowledgeable. Passionate about teaching and eager to help students succeed.

Mitra is awesome!! She's definitely not a pushover, and has a rigid set of policies.  But she's passionate about accounting and about teaching.  Always willing to help students online or in class. Gives opportunities throughout the semester for bonus credits. Do your homework, study for the in-class quizzes, STAY for class and you'll do fine.

Mitra is great, funny, and enthusiastic. She loves accounting and it shows. I took her 8 week summer course late at night and she was so into it even at 10:30 at night. You must buy the book. She gives extra credit for attendance, and a short quiz every class. She gets personally offended if you leave early so plan to stay.

Mitra is awesome. I took her 4 week summer course, and she was great. She was always willing to stay late and help you if you needed it. She went out of the way to help everyone. This course is hard, but she makes it easier to understand. Best professor I've had at KSU!

BEST PROF EVER!!!!!! Mitra is one of the best prof. i have had at KSU thus far. She' s very energetic and loves what she is teaching (even early saturday am). Very fair grading and always there for help if you need it. She is also one of the most compassionate people ive ever met! I will be sure to take her for my future accounting classes.  =)

Loved Mitra! Very hard class but not because of the professor.  She goes out of her way to help with extra credit, extra class, and detailed explanations to questions.  I had her for a Saturday class and three different times she offered us a second class on Wednesday for students who needed help(she was not paid for these extra class). Take Her!

Mitra is a wonderful professor! She is super enthusiastic about accounting and it shows she loves to teach. The class is very challenging, but as long as you attend classes, do the homework and understand the material you will do fine in the class. Mitra is super fair and gives bonus problems for those who attend. I would recommend taking this prof

Challenging class no matter who. She is enthusiastic and wants you to do well. Read. Study. Do homework. She'll answer questions. No pushover but is fair. She's trying to get you prepared for higher classes. Get your coffee and listen and participate. B in class.
i really like her. she is fun and really loves her job.

What I liked most about prof. Bathai was her enthusiasm. She had an upbeat and quirky sense of humor. The class was hard (no matter who taught it) but you will do ok if you do the work and study. She would stay late to answer questions and was very good about answering emails. I thought she was fair but not a pushover.

She loves what she teaches and it shows.  Tests are difficult but gives ample oppertunity to pull up grade through curves and bonus points.  Ultimately she wants you to learn material and wont kill your gpa in process

The material is hard to begin with, she does an okay job trying to explain. The study guides are vague and a waste to time, attendance not mandatory. She tries to be fair with her grading. Stay away if you are just trying to get by!
very hard.
